comments.body: because spark-2.4 does not support mergeJoin hint, so I modify this ut
This test case seems to succeed without your patch.

nit format:
```
      "CREATE TEMPORARY VIEW t1 AS SELECT * FROM VALUES(1, 2) AS t1(k, v);" -> "",
      "CREATE TEMPORARY VIEW t2 AS SELECT * FROM VALUES(2, 1) AS t2(k, v);" -> "",
      "EXPLAIN SELECT /*+ MERGEJOIN(t1) */ t1.* FROM t1 JOIN t2 ON t1.k = t2.v;" -> "SortMergeJoin",
      "EXPLAIN SELECT /* + MERGEJOIN(t1) */ t1.* FROM t1 JOIN t2 ON t1.k = t2.v;"
        -> "BroadcastHashJoin"
```
Looks ok to me, but instead do we need to see what will happen if `;` is ignored wrongly while it's in the hint
For example `EXPLAIN SELECT /*+ MERGEJOIN(t1); */ t1.* FROM t1 JOIN t2 ON t1.k = t2.v;`, will the ';' be ignored?
sure, the `;` in ` /* + MERGEJOIN(t1); */` in  will be ignored
So `/*+ MERGEJOIN(t1); */ ` === `/*+ MERGEJOIN(t1) */`? I am not very familiar with hints

no,  the ; in /* + MERGEJOIN(t1); */ in will be ignored means that the `;` would be treated as a delimiter, which used to split sql statements.


`EXPLAIN SELECT /*+ MERGEJOIN(t1); */ t1.* FROM t1 JOIN t2 ON t1.k = t2.v` would be transfered to SparkSQLCliDriver totally.
maybe we should add these to test?
sure, will add one

That's expected behavior and not be affected by this change
Could you explicitly set false at `spark.sql.parser.escapedStringLiterals` for the tests below?
Actually this has nothing to do with `spark.sql.parser.escapedStringLiterals`, even if the config is set to true, the parser should accept this string.
Ur, I got it. I think the option is misleading... Could you remove it from the PR descritpion?
Done that, thanks!
do we miss a finally clause?
how do we verify if the warehouse path is picked?
the hive.xxx.xxx.dir is from the global variable `warehousePath`, if the `sparkWareHouseDir` not picked, the db location of default will be the hive one

I also checked manually
#### now
```sql
kentyao@hulk î‚° ~/Downloads/spark/spark-3.1.0-SNAPSHOT-bin-v20200317 î‚° bin/spark-sql -S --conf spark.sql.warehouse.dir=/Users/kentyao/Downloads/spark/spark-3.1.0-SNAPSHOT-bin-v20200317/data/spark-warehouse
spark-sql> desc database default;
```

```sql
spark-sql> desc database default;
```
